page.title: 06Thurstaston Common
page.content: Thurstaston Common is a high piece of ground covered in heather,silver birch and conifers. If it is a clear day, there is a beautiful view over to Wales.Many people enjoy picnics on the common. There is a large sandstone rock called Thor's Stone.Nobody knows how the rock came to be there,but there are many stories about it.One says that the Vikings put it there to make sacrifices to Thor, the God of Thunder. Another says that Thor threw this great rock down to Earth. The name Thurstaston comes from the words Thor's Stone.
